testCases.explanation: From node 2: reach 1 in 1s, reach 3 in 1s, reach 4 in 2s. Max = 2.
From node 1, reach node 2 in 1 unit of time.
From node 2, node 1 is unreachable. Not all nodes can be reached.
From node 1: reach 2 in 1s, reach 3 via 2 in 3s (1+2 < 4 direct). Max = 3.
From node 1, reach node 2 in 1s. Node 1 itself costs 0. Max = 1.

description:
Solve the **Network Delay Time** problem.

There are n network nodes labeled 1 to n. times[i] = [u, v, w] is a directed edge from u to v with travel time w. Starting from node k, find the minimum time for the signal to reach all n nodes. Return -1 if not all nodes can be reached.

See the full problem description on [LeetCode](https://leetcode.com/problems/network-delay-time/).

examples.explanation: Signal reaches all nodes from k=2 in max 2 time units.
